data.title: State Water Board Approves Emergency Curtailment Measures for the Delta Watershed
data.excerpt: With climate change-induced drought reducing water levels in the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta to alarming lows, the State Water Resources Control Board today approved an emergency curtailment regulation with measures to preserve stored water to protect drinking water supplies, prevent salinity intrusion and minimize impacts to fisheries and the environment.
data.author: Chach Sikes
